Atmospheric Monitoring Systems. ODH safety system controls are a subsystem of AMS. Explosive levels of a gas inside a tunnel are also a subsystem of AMS. These are systems that are typically managed with Atmospheric Monitoring System Configuration Control Forms by Operations.

Area of Refuge Example: For life safety, the Linac shafts will be modified to provide an area of refuge to allow for evacuation up the ladders in the event of a fire or oxygen deficiency life safety event. It is assumed a fire-rated barrier with a door will be installed at the base of egress shafts for the SC Linac.

Area of Refuge For life safety, the LINAC shafts will be modified to provide an area of refuge to allow for evacuation up the ladders in the event of a fire or oxygen deficiency life safety event. A fire-rated barrier with a door will be installed at the base of egress shafts for the SC LINAC.
Air Quality Monitor. ESH and operations have air monitors at high loss points for periodic sampling of air. These monitors are not all interlocked to the PPS Access Controls.
Advanced Study Group (of the Max Planck Society)

ASTM International, known until 2001 as the American Society for Testing and Materials (ASTM), is an international standards organization that develops and publishes voluntary consensus technical standards for a wide range of materials, products, systems, and services.

A mechanical/electrical standard for computing/networking, here used for the timing fanout system.

Beam Authorization Sheet. The BAS is the ultimate document of record that lists all pre-running conditions (including required BCS devices) for accelerator beams.
Beam Authorization Sheet. The BAS is the ultimate document of record that lists all pre- running conditions (including required BCS devices) for accelerator beams.
Beam Containment System. In the context of this FRS, this always refers to the electronic restraints and active components and does not refer to mechanical components such as shielding.

Beam Containment System BCS: protects the integrity of beam protection collimators and PPS stoppers, prevents beam losses inside the accelerator enclosure that can cause unacceptable radiation levels outside the enclosure, and ensures beam operations remain within the operational safety envelope.

Beam Containment System. In the context of this specification document, this always refers to the electronic restraints and active components and does not refer to the mechanical components such as shielding

Beam Containment System (mechanical devices such as collimators, magnets, beam stoppers, beam dumps, and electronic devices such as average current monitors, burn-through monitors, and Beam Shutoff Ion Chamber)
Beam Containment System. In the context of this document, this always refers to the electronic restraints and active components and does not refer to mechanical components such as shielding
Beam Containment System. In the context of this PRD, this always refers to the electronic restraints and active components and does not refer to mechanical components such as shielding.
Beam Containment System for the Accelerator facility (electron enclosures). It provides permits to operate the accelerator facility.

Beam Containment System for photon experimental areas. These systems are localized safety systems that are inputs to the larger, expansive, BCS Electron. BCS Photon inhibits the injectors through the BCS Electron.
SLAC Building Inspection Office, the Authority Having Jurisdiction
Building Inspection Office reviews installation plans for code compliance, safety, authorization to build or construct, inspections, and final occupancy or completion approval.
Building Inspection Office Plan Review System

Beam Imminent Warning Audio and visual warning in the PPS enclosures that the beam is about to come on and personnel need to push an emergency off button and leave. The audio warning is a siren sound alternated with instructions. The visual warning is the flashing of the overhead tunnel lights. The audio and visual warning is simultaneous with the exception of the LINAC accelerator enclosure.
Beamline Authorization sheet. The equivalent of the BAS for photon hutches.
BeamLine Data. Collects data in the same clock pulse from many devices in the beamlines.
Beam Line Data. Collects data in the same clock pulse from many devices in the beamlines.
Beam Line Data (synchronous multicast event data transmissions)
Bunch Length Monitor (unfortunately this acronym is overloaded)
Beam Loss Monitor. (unfortunately this acronym is overloaded)

Basic Process Control System (as used in ANSI/ISA 84). For the accelerator region (gallery and LINAC tunnel), this is EPICS. For the cryogenics plant, this would be the Allen-Bradley PLC based plant control system.
Beam Synchronous Acquisition. Collects data in the same clock pulse from many devices in the accelerator.
Beam Synchronous Acquisition (asynchronous buffered data transmissions)

Beam Shut Off Ion Chamber. One of a number of PPS radiation- monitoring devices situated at strategic points throughout the machine, usually close to, but on the outside of, the beam housing shielding. Ionization of the gas-filled chamber by radiation will cause the BSOIC to trip off the beam if the level of radiation is above the trip point of the chamber.
Beam Shut Off Ion Chambers, installed at locations requiring monitoring of radiation doses outside the shielding.
Beam Transport Hall, section of the existing facility
Beam Transport Hall West (West end of LTU Transport)
Beam Transfer Line. Comprised of DOG, Bypass, and Spreader
Beam Through Monitor. In this document, BTM refers to the LCLS-II diode- based BTMs (Ref: BTM ESD).

Bending magnet sending beams to main dumps (bend on Y Direction)
Bend magnets, Y (vertical), to electron Dump,
Bend Y Dipole (last string before dump)

cryomodule for the 12 GeV upgrade of the CEBAF facility
Channel Access network protocol used by EPICS

Cryogenic Bypass is a vacuum insulated cryogenic transfer line that allows for warm beam line space within a Linac by bypassing the cryogenic circuit

Central Control Room (B003). Operations staff no longer uses B003 for the primary control of the LINAC facility, but the major controls cabling for the remote control of the Accelerator is still at the wiring hub, the B003 mainframe. The PPS Global LINAC PLCs, which reside in this building, are referred to collectively as the “CCR PPS.”

Central Control Room (Building 3). The CCR was the primary control room for the initial operation of the LINAC. Operators no longer operate the LINAC from CCR, but the major PPS wiring infrastructure for the control of the LINAC is still in building 3. The major hub for the LINAC PPS, the CCR LINAC West and LINAC East PLCs are in B003. LINAC West is currently used for FACET PPS beam interlocking. LINAC East is currently used for LCLS PPS beam interlocking, but will be expanded to include LCLS-II interlock logic. These two systems are often referred to as the CCR PPS PLCs.

The B003 PPS PLCs that permit the operation of the Injector through LINAC Radiation Hazards. These PLCs also perform the high level logic to determine if it is safe to set access to the Injector through LINAC with respect to prompt-ionizing radiation hazards. There are two subsystems, LINACs East and West. Details are found in CD-SS-PPS-02-11-09, Central Control Room (CCR) PPS Logic Specification.
Configuration Control System. Used in photon experimental areas and interlocked to HPS.
Critical Decision 0: approval of mission need
Critical Decision 1: Approval of alternative selection and cost range
Performance Baseline Review Completion of preliminary design, development of a performance baseline that contains a detailed scope, schedule, and cost estimate
Critical Decision 2: approval of performance baseline
Approve Start of Construction Review Completion of essentially all design and engineering and beginning of construction, implementation, procurement, or fabrication.
Critical Decision 3: approval of start of construction
Critical Decision 4: approval of project completion

Electrical contacts that serve a secondary function and so do not have the current used for the primary function through them. Dry contacts provided by PPS are ready for a non-PPS voltage source to be connected and independently fused. All dry contacts provided by the PPS will be sourced with 24Vdc unless specifically negotiated.

Electron beam welding is a fusion welding process in which a beam of high-velocity electrons is applied to two materials to be joined. The work pieces melt and flow together as the kinetic energy of the electrons is transformed into heat upon impact. EBW is often performed under vacuum conditions to prevent dissipation of the electron beam.

Hot Spares are components that are installed and ready for operations with a minimal amount of effort because the installation/repair time would lead to unacceptably long downtimes. These are redundant components (or components that can be switched on/off almost instantly) used to eliminate or nearly eliminate the MTTR for the overall system.

The SLAC 3 Km linac is divided into 100 meter segments. These segments are called “Sectors” and numbered 0 through 30 from west to east. The removal project activities will take place in Sectors 0 through 10.

A tunnel that branches from the north side of the main linac housing in Sector 10 to an at-grade tunnel access point. This tunnel is currently blocked by a shield wall, which will be removed as part of the removal project.

TeV Energy Superconducting Linear Accelerator – the predecessor to the ILC concept, developed collaboratively by DESY, Saclay, INFN, Fermilab, Jefferson Lab, Cornell, and other labs and universities under the leadership of DESY. The LCLS-II cryomodule configuration (RF cavities in close-fitting helium vessels suspended from a large helium return pipe, cryogenic piping all within the cryostat) comes from the TESLA collaboration. Hence it is referred to here as TESLA-style.

TeV Energy Superconducting Linear Accelerator – the predecessor to the ILC concept, developed collaboratively by DESY, Saclay, INFN, Fermilab, Jefferson Lab and Cornell as well as other labs and universities under the leadership of DESY.The LCLS-II cryomodule configuration (RF cavities in close-fitting helium vessels suspended from a large helium return pipe, cryogenic piping all within the cryostat) comes from the TESLA collaboration. Hence it is referred to here as TESLA-style.
Terahertz radiation – frequencies above a few hundred GHz, but below optical.

Gas tungsten arc welding (GTAW), also known as tungsten inert gas (TIG) welding, is an arc welding process that uses a non-consumable tungsten electrode to produce the weld. The weld area is protected from atmospheric contamination by an inert shielding gas (argon or helium), and a filler metal is normally used, though some welds, known as autogenous welds, do not require it. A constant-current welding power supply produces energy which is conducted across the arc through a column of highly ionized gas and metal vapors known as a plasma.
Transfer line: a cryogenic component used to transfer cryogens between various CDS and CP components

Variable Voltage Substation One VVS supplies ~600Vac to ~16 klystron modulators. The klystrons are prompt-ionizing radiation hazards. The mitigation of the radiation hazard is through interlocking of the VVS circuit breaker. The VVS reports the position of the circuit breaker and the absence of voltage after the circuit breaker to the PPS controls.
